name: places/ChIJuXXfgbNZwokRqJNDvnIpoJA
formattedAddress: 550 W 34th St., New York, NY 10001, USA
adrFormatAddress: 550 W 34th St., New York, NY 10001, USA

originalText.text:
My ride with Megabus was pretty nice. The WiFi, as you may already know by reading the other reviews, doesn't work. The bus driver said she couldn't do anything about it. But I didn't care because there was so much to see on the road (I sat in the front on top, although you have to reserve that seat it is very recommended!). The seat was comfortable enough to sit all the way through.

Luckily I didn't experience the horror stories about passengers being left in a city and that the airco was being left on for the whole trip making the bus freezing cold. The bus driver even made a joke that she forgot her jacket so she wouldn't make the bus too cold. Also, she said if there were any problems we could go down anytime to explain them.

Overall, riding with Megabus was a nice experience. But if they are advertising with WiFi in the bus it must really work. 4/5

originalText.text: I have been riding this bus since many years and this is second time delayed TWO HOURS. They charged a lot money from us and not providing service according to scheduled departure time. It’s freezing and windy side of Hudson River. They must relocated somewhere else than better place for the bus stop. I wouldn’t give star but no way to complain without giving star. Worse bus ever ride in my life. :( :( :(

Worse bus ever ride in my life. :( :( :(

originalText.text: Initially, when I worked in Long Island and I walked by 34th street/Hudson Yards, I saw these lines of people outside in the cold and I thought these were soup kitchens for the homeless....I had no idea Manhattan didn't have a proper bus station like most other cities. After having driven dozens of times through Manhattan to get to DC, I figured I had to try bussing out for a change. I bought Megabus tickets and low and behold, I end up waiting in line with all the "homeless" :-). I have to admit that if you can get a good seat on the second level of the bus right at the front or if you can be next to the driver, it is pure pleasure to watch traffic, to enter the different tunnels and be in a totally relaxed mode instead of having to drive and curse your way through Jersey City and all the other traffic messes from what is slowly but surely becoming a third world megalopolis. I have taken Megabus to Philadelphia, Boston, Albany, DC, Baltimore, Pittsburgh, it's been great every time.

originalText.text: It was a great first experience on a megabus. The ride was quick and peaceful. I didn’t realize there wasn’t any bag space on the bus itself, so I put my hiking pack under the bus. I will definitely take the megabus again

text.text: It was a great first experience on a megabus. The ride was quick and peaceful. I didn’t realize there wasn’t any bag space on the bus itself, so I put my hiking pack under the bus. I will definitely take the megabus again

originalText.text:
No matter how much money you are trying to save…don’t choose megabus. Pay money for the Amtrak. This is the worst rising experience I’ve ever had in my life. We were supposed to get to NYC at 7:55 pm and we got to NYC at 11:26 pm. All they did was give us credit back and not money back.

How did this happen you may ask? Well we had to change buses twice. The first reason was someone was in a wheelchair and they couldn’t move the seats. So when we were supposed to leave at 3:20 we left at 4:20 because they got a whole new bus.

Then we stopped in Maryland to pick up a couple of folks and then I noticed we were sitting there for an hour and someone was like there is no driver. Apparently the bus driver and crew left and didn’t tell us that there was actually something wrong with the bus.

we didn’t leave White Marsh, MD until after 8:30 pm. All we did was receive credit and no money back. And I have a cold because of how filthy it is on the bus.
